title: Proud Papa braggin' on his daughter
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031841im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/julia-CMU-grad-card_6387.png)

 [‹ Simoncini Garamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031841/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20299 "Go to previous forum topic") [Kudos to Kris Sowersby ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031841/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19684 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dezcom

comments.content: Nice. Good excuse to use one of your own creations for one of your own creations. Congratulations, Chris.
Mazal Tov!

What are the fonts in this graphic??? Looks really good!

Mikey

Thank you one and all!

Good line Tiff! Thanks William!

Mikey, The fonts are 2 of my own designs. The text is in “ [Now Sans Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031841/http:/typophile.com/node/16147)” and the bold is a new design I just started called “Lozenge”. Lozenge is actually half of an ego/alter-ego pair of fonts that are very similar but one is wonkier and one is more normal—kind of a leftbrain rightbrain thing.

ChrisL

Congratulations and best of luck to your daughter Julia.

You have every right to be proud, papa!  
\> p.s. — If you’re printing that announcement, I’ll trade you one of my vintage creations come August at TypeCon... deal?

Deal! I’ll be happy to give you one Norbert and would welcome one of your vintage creations.

ChrisL

Funny... I already had an item months ago to give you.  
Something that you actually wished for in an old post.  
No sense guessing, just act surprised! ;-)

Why am I getting a Tuskalusah vibe out of this? :-)

ChrisL

You’ll have to excuse me, Chris, but Pittsburgh is a tad out of my way. ;^P

Congratulations to both your daughter and you. :^)

LOL!!! Good one Yves :-)

ChrisL

congratulations!

on a related note, the carnegie mellon university has an awesome collection of swiss poster designs from the last 40 years.

Thierry,  
Thank you!

CMU also had some fine swiss poster examples from the 50s and 60s—mostly posters of Armin Hoffman.

ChrisL

For anyone interested in the Carnegie Mellon Design Department, here is a link to their site:

[http://www.design.cmu.edu/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828031841/http:/www.design.cmu.edu/ "http://www.design.cmu.edu/")

That was a shameless plug from an alum:-)

ChrisL
Way to go, Chris! Of course, it is your daughter that we should really be congratulating, isn’t it?

Thanks Dan! Yup, she did all the work, I just paid the bills:-)

ChrisL

\>it is your daughter that we should really be congratulating

It’s both, it’s both. And Dad does more than pay the bills, though that’s not exactly small, especially for Carnegie Mellon!

Welcome to the graduated daughters club Chris.

Yes, that’s graduated—not staggered, though that exists too, at least for me.

Thanks Peter :-)

I still have a son who is graduating high school this year so I still have more to come!

ChrisL

Congratulations to you and Julia.

Reminds me of my own graduation, which was made a bit uneasy by a fellow grad who decided to thank his mother by writing “THAX MA” in tape on his mortar board.

Maybe that was just a long name or his fraternity? :-)

ChrisL
He might have just misspelled “Thanx Ma”, which is already misspelled. Several of the other grads had that on the mortar board. Funny and sad.
Cool bit of a rocket scientist she is eh...to get in there...

Congratulations to you and Julia!

Wave hello to Maggie Mo for me when you’re on campus.

Vincent,  
My wife and I are both CMU graduates but my daughter has a 190 IQ as well as a great musical talent.

ChrisL

LOL!!! I sure will Chris!

ChrisL
